entry.title: Combined summary - New tool to assist in BIP 340-342 review: tap
entry.summary: The Bitcoin Script Debugger (btcdeb) has unveiled a new experimental branch called "taproot" that incorporates a new command line tool named "tap". This tool enables users to create taproot and/or tapscript outputs for funding and spending. The taproot build is based on the WIP taproot pull request to Bitcoin Core.Users can access a detailed tutorial on how to use this tool on btcdeb's Github page. Feedback on the new tool is appreciated, encouraging users to share their thoughts and opinions on the experimental branch. The taproot protocol update is aimed at improving the privacy, fungibility, and smart contract flexibility of Bitcoin transactions. It is currently being reviewed by the Bitcoin community and if approved, it will be implemented in a future Bitcoin Core release. Overall, the introduction of the "tap" command line tool by btcdeb is a step towards simplifying the process of composing taproot and/or tapscript outputs for funding and spending. With its potential to enhance privacy and smart contract capabilities, the taproot protocol update is an exciting development in the world of Bitcoin.
